pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1968–69)

rows.text: Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-100C disappeared in bad weather on a morning flight from Tuy Hoa Air Base
Wounded and disappeared following a Vietcong ambush
Artillery observer on O-1G #51-5059 that disappeared while returning from a visual reconnaissance mission near Khe Sanh Combat Base
Killed in action, body not recovered
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #152586 shot down on a night strike mission
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0286 hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0286 hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Wounded and left behind when his unit was ambushed. The area was later shelled and then secured but no remains were recovered.
Pilot of F-4D #66-7474 shot down on a daytime bombing mission, no ejection observed
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-7474 shot down on a daytime bombing mission, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Killed by a mine while on patrol, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Hit by enemy fire while on patrol, he was left behind as his unit was forced to withdraw
Pilot of F-4D #65‑0651 hit by enemy fire on a night strike mission. The weapons system operator 1Lt Gordon K Breault ejected successfully and was rescued
His A-4C #149529 was hit by enemy fire and crashed on a night strike mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1J #52-14208 was hit by enemy fire and crashed while supporting the rescue of 1LT Gordon K Breault
Disappeared from his observation post following an enemy mortar attack
Disappeared following a command detonated explosion, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on KA-3B #138943 that disappeared while returning from a night refueling mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on KA-3B #138943 that disappeared while returning from a night refueling mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Crewman on F-4J #155763 which crashed into the sea on launch
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66-8814 hit by enemy fire on a night bombing mission
Presumptive finding of death. His remains were identified in October 2012
Passenger on UH-1H #65-10020 that crashed killing all 9 persons on board. During the recovery operation his body was dropped from the recovery helicopter
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D #61-0109 was hit by enemy fire, no ejection observed
Team leader of a reconnaissance unit, he was killed by enemy fire and left behind when the position was overrun
Killed in action, body not recovered
Member of a reconnaissance unit, he was killed by enemy fire and left behind when the position was overrun
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared after falling down an embankment while on patrol
Died in captivity, remains not returned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #65‑0722 hit by enemy fire, both crewmen ejected successfully and contacted SAR forces. The weapons system operator CPT Aldis P. Rutyna was later rescued
Member of a 5-man reconnaissance team, he was separated from his team following an ambush
Pilot of A-6A #154160 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a night bombing mission. The remains of the bombardier/navigator CPT Charles E. Finney were identified in 2000
His F-105 #61-0104 was hit be enemy fire and he ejected successfully. SAR forces located his body but were unable to recover it due to enemy presence
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when his team was ambushed on a bomb damage assessment mission, his body could not be recovered due to enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by enemy fire during an ambush, his body was left behind due to enemy presence
Disappeared after the ARVN base at Tam Soc was overrun
Disappeared after becoming separated from his unit while on a road interdiction mission
Wounded and then disappeared after becoming separated from his unit while on a road interdiction mission
Disappeared after becoming separated from his unit while on a road interdiction mission
Disappeared when his unit was attacked on a reconnaissance patrol and forced to withdraw
Pilot of F-4D #66-8764 hit by enemy fire on a close air support mission, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-8764 hit by enemy fire on a close air support mission, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-8809 hit by enemy fire on a defoliation mission. The pilot Captain W. J. Popendorf ejected successfully and was rescued
Wounded and left behind when his unit was forced to withdraw while trying to receover bodies of soldiers killed several days previously
Pilot of F-4D #66‑8766 that disappared on a bombing mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑8766 that disappared on a bombing mission
Copilot of AH-1G #67-15677 that disintegrated in middair during a gun run. The remains of the pilot Capt. Alvie J. Ledford were recovered 7 days later
Pilot of UH-1D #66-16343 hit by enemy fire, crashed and burned. His remains later disappeared from the wreckage
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-100D was hit by enemy fire on a night bombing mission
Medic wounded and then disappeared while awaiting medical evacuation
Weapons system operator on F-4D #65‑0649hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #65‑0649hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-2A that disappeared on a forward air control mission

Pilot of F-4C #64‑0805 hit by enemy fire, both crewmen ejected successfully, but one parachute failed to deploy properly. One crewman contacted SAR forces but contact was lost before a rescue could begin

Weapons system operator on F-4C #64‑0805 hit by enemy fire, both crewmen ejected successfully, but one parachute failed to deploy properly. One crewman contacted SAR forces but contact was lost before a rescue could begin
Operator of a barge-mounted crane that fell into the Saigon River
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar intercept officer on F-4B #15288 hit by enemy fire. The pilot 1LT Gary Bain ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of O-1G #51-16959 that disappeared while conducting a radio relay mission for a MACV-SOG patrol
Observer on O-1G #51-16959 that disappeared while conducting a radio relay mission for a MACV-SOG patrol
Leader of a 2-man machine gun team that disappeared while providing cover for a reconnaissance in force mission
Member of a 2-man machine gun team that disappeared while providing cover for a reconnaissance in force mission

Weapons system operator on F-4D hit by enemy fire near the Mu Gia Pass. He ejected successfully and contacted SAR forces, a pararescueman was lowered to his position and found him dead, but was unable to recover his body due to enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered

Wounded during a firefight, he was being medevaced when the helicopter took off quickly due to enemy fire and he was hanging on to the helicopter skid, he lost his grip and fell from an altitude of 500 feet
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared when his position was overrun
Crew chief on UH-1H #68-15392 shot down while inserting a MACV-SOG team. All crewmebers were killed and his body was pinned under the wreckage and could not be recovered.
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-100D was hit by enemy fire and crashed at sea offshore of Phu Yen Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when his MIKE Force unit was attacked by enemy forces, his body was unable to be recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Artillery forward observer killed when enemy mortar fire hit an ammunition dump causing a secondary explosion, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when enemy mortar fire hit an ammunition dump causing a secondary explosion, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered
Driver of an ammunition truck hit by enemy fire causing a secondary explosion, no recoverable remains
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of F-4D #66‑7574 hit by enemy fire, both crewmen ejected successfully. While being rescued, the helicopter hit a tree and he fell from the jungle penetrator from a height of 300 feet. The weapons system operator 1LT Wayne Karas was rescued.
His F-105 #60-5381 crashed into a cliff on a bombing run

Point man on a patrol that was ambushed, he was seen to be hit be enemy fire, but his body could not be recovered. When friendly forces secured the area the next day they were unable to locate his body
Killed in action, body not recovered
Attack Squadron 144, USS Bon Homme Richard (CV-31)
His A-4E #152029 hit the ground on a night bombing mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed by a mortar round exploding prematurely on a night fire mission offshore of Khanh Hoa Province, his body was blown into the water and lost during recovery
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-1 was hit by enemy fire and he ejected successfully. His last radio contact advised that he was wounded and surrounded by enemy forces
Listed as killed in action, body not recovered, until April 2013 when his remains were identified
Pilot of A-26A #64-17646 hit by enemy fire and crashed on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Listed as killed in action, body not recovered until April 2013 when his remains were identified
Pilot of F-4D #66-7697 that disappeared in bad weather on a Fast-FAC mission
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66-7697 that disappeared in bad weather on a Fast-FAC mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7603 that crashed on a night bombing mission. The remains of the weapons system operator 1LT Harmon Polster were returned in 2007
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4E #154993 hit the ground on an attack run
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4C #147833 crashed on launch and he was unable to be rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Severely wounded and left behind when his reconnaissance team was ambushed while awaiting helicopter extraction
Severely wounded and left behind when his reconnaissance team was ambushed while awaiting helicopter extraction
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67‑0323 hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4E #67‑0323 hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of UH-1E #155339 hit by enemy fire and crashed in flames into a river during an emergency extraction mission. The pilot MAJ Thomas B Hill and the crew chief LCPL John O Dean were rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1E #155339 hit by enemy fire and crashed in flames into a river
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-4E #151131 crashed into the carrier during a night landing and the wreckage fell into the sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1C hit by enemy fire and crash-landed, the crew was evacuated by another helicopter and he was only able to hang onto a skid and he later fell from a height of at least 100 feet
Pilot of F-4B #151012 that disappeared while returning from a night strike mission over Quang Tin Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Radar intercept operator on F-4B #151012 that disappeared while returning from a night strike mission over Quang Tin Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #149416 that disappeared while escorting a photo reconnaissance mission. The remains of the radar intercept officer Capt. John N. Flanigan were returned in 1989
Radar intercept officer on F-4B #153041 hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4B #153041 hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7530shot down on a bombing mission. The remains of the weapons system operator Capt Roger H. Stearns were returned in 1990
Killed in action, body not recovered
His reconnaissance team was ambushed shortly after insertion and he was shot and killed, his body was left behind as the remaining team members evacuated
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #68-15558hit by enemy fire while extracting an MACV-SOG team, the helicopter crash-landed and his body was pinned under the wreckage which then caught fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on C-2A #152796 that crashed on approach to the USS Constellation
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on C-2A #152796 that crashed on approach to the USS Constellation
Killed in action, body not recovered

Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer on OV-1C #61-02679 that crashed into a mountain on an afternoon reconnaissance mission. SAR forces were unable to investigate the wreckage
Pilot of OV-1C #61-02679 that crashed into a mountain on an afternoon reconnaissance mission
Drowned when a boat he was riding in on patrol capsized
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of AH-1G that crash-landed while making an emergency night landing, the pilot Capt. Robert T. Andrews confirmed that Watkins was dead and was rescued 5 days later
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on UH-1H #63-08826 that hit terrain and crashed into the Dong Nai River, where it is believed he drowned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on UH-1H #63-08826 that hit terrain and crashed into the Dong Nai River, where it is believed he drowned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger on UH-1H #63-08826 that hit terrain and crashed into the Dong Nai River, where it is believed he drowned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #63-08826 that hit terrain and crashed into the Dong Nai River, where it is believed he drowned
Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer on O-1G #51-11942 that crashed into a river on a daytime reconnaissance mission. SAR forces later located the wreckage but were unable to locate any bodies
Pilot of O-1G #51-11942 that crashed into a river on a daytime reconnaissance mission. SAR forces later located the wreckage but were unable to locate any bodies
Pilot of OV-1C lost on a night reconnaissance mission
Observer on OV-1C lost on a night reconnaissance mission
Killed in an ambush, his body was left behind when the team withdrew under enemy fire
Pilot of O-2A shot down on a FAC mission. The remains of the observer Major John Espenshied were returned in 1989
Weapons system operator on F-4D #65-0751 that crashed into the ground on a rocket run
Pilot of F-4D #65-0751 that crashed into the ground on a rocket run
His A-1H crashed on an armed reconnaissance mission
Killed during a patrol, his body was left behind as his unit engaged enemy forces and later disappeared
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copliot/Observer on F-100F #56-3796 that disappeared on a Misty FAC mission
Pilot of F-100F #56-3796 that disappeared on a Misty FAC mission
Disappeared when his unit came under fire while withdrawing from a forward artillery base
Pilot of UH-1H #67-19512 that disappeared in bad weather on an evening flight to Nha Trang
Copilot of UH-1H #67-19512 that disappeared in bad weather on an evening flight to Nha Trang
Gunner on UH-1H #67-19512 that disappeared in bad weather on an evening flight to Nha Trang
Crew Chief on UH-1H #67-19512 that disappeared in bad weather on an evening flight to Nha Trang
His F-105D #59-1734 was hit by enemy fire
Listed as presumptive finding of death until March 2013 when his remains were identified
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑7748 lost on a night FAC mission
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7748 lost on a night FAC mission
Pilot of F-4E #67-0219 hit by enemy fire while supporting a night rescue mission, no ejection observed
Weapons system operator on F-4E #67-0219 hit by enemy fire while supporting a night rescue mission, no ejection observed
Pilot of A-1H #52-139821 shot down while supporting rescue efforts for F-4E #67-0219, no ejection observed
Killed when his reconnaissance team was ambushed and overrun
Killed when his reconnaissance team was ambushed and overrun

Observer on OV-1C Mohawk aircraft #61-2690 hit by enemy fire on a visual reconnaissance misison, both crewmen ejected successfully and were captured. The pilot Capt Robert White later reported that Graf had apparently drowned while attempting to escape in January 1970
Pilot of O-2A hit by enemy fire on a visual reconnaissance mission. SAR forces located the wreckage quickly but no bodies were seen
Instructor pilot of O-2A hit by enemy fire on a visual reconnaissance mission. SAR forces located the wreckage quickly but no bodies were seen
Pilot of A-6A #155607 lost on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #155607 lost on a night armed reconnaissance mission
Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #155613 that suffered structural failure on a bombing run. The pilot CDR L W Richards ejected successfully and was rescued
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-105D crashed in low cloud during a bombing mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
His RF-8A was hit by enemy fire on a reconnaissance mission and crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of UH-1C #66-00587 that crashed due to mechanical problems. SAR forces arrived and they were being evacuated by helicopter using a McGuire rig when he fell from a height of approximately 2500 feet
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1C #66-00587 that crashed due to mechanical problems, he disappeared from the crash site and SAR forces were unable to locate him

Bombardier/navigator on A-6A #152891 that crashed on final approach due to mechanical failure, both crewman ejected but their parachutes did not have time to deploy. The body of the pilot LTJG Walter H Kosky was recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of F-4D #66‑7590 that hit the ground on a bombing run, no ejection observed
Weapons system operator on F-4D #66‑7590 that hit the ground on a bombing run, no ejection observed
